intro.speaker: NARRATOR
intro.text: Jack blinks—then realizes the world is frozen mid-motion.

intro.speaker: NARRATOR
intro.text: Dust hangs in the air like pixels that never refresh.

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: Don’t panic. Time stuttered. You’re seeing the pause between ticks.

intro.speaker: JACK
intro.text: Who are you?

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: Jessica. I can’t pull you out—only guide you node by node.

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: Rule one: trust the clock. Time is never decoration here.

hints.text: The node time is fixed. Use the MINUTES as a number.
Triangles never repeat a color until the cycle is exhausted.
Two rectangles are anchors: red and orange never change.

intro.speaker: NARRATOR
intro.text: Switchboards click like chess clocks. Every click is a branch.

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: This node rewards precision. Think in moves and consequences.

intro.speaker: JACK
intro.text: So… I fork time itself.

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: Exactly. A fork is one action attacking multiple futures.

hints.text: The winning move is a knight fork—king plus a major piece.
Write the move like Ne7 (piece + square).

intro.speaker: NARRATOR
intro.text: The walls are glass. Code is etched where advertisements should be.

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: This node tests prediction. If you can predict the branch, you can escape the loop.

intro.speaker: JACK
intro.text: So I’m debugging time.

hints.text: Run it mentally. Track the variable that decides the final node.
Watch modulo conditions; they decide which branch overwrites the destination.

intro.speaker: NARRATOR
intro.text: Text rewrites itself like a memory trying to stabilize.

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: Patterns are gates. Choose wrong and the story continues—without reward.

intro.speaker: JACK
intro.text: So it’s not fail-stop. It’s fail-soft.

hints.text: Anchor symbols: hyphen, digits, suffix. Don’t ignore boundaries ^ and $.
Pick the option that matches ALL generated strings, not just one.

intro.speaker: NARRATOR
intro.text: A city of holograms negotiates with futures.

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: Two trials. One teaches that losing isn’t always losing.

intro.speaker: JACK
intro.text: That sounds like a trap.

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: It is. But it’s also a lesson about time: meaning depends on the scheme.

hints.text: TicTacToe sequence is derived from node time digits.
Sometimes you must lose a round to satisfy the sequence.
In the dilemma, your opponent mirrors you after round 1.

intro.speaker: NARRATOR
intro.text: The final door is not a door.

intro.speaker: NARRATOR
intro.text: It is a choice written in a language time understands.

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: If you made it here, you’ve collected fragments. Combine them—carefully.

intro.speaker: JACK
intro.text: Then the loop ends?

intro.speaker: JESSICA
intro.text: Or it begins with you in control.

hints.text: Final password is a hash-derived phrase from your earned tokens.
